paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Increased expression of HERG channels and altered calcium homeostasis.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: El-Brattrawy and colleagues investigated the pathogenesis of patients with Short QT-Syndrome (SQTS) and generated human iPSC-CMs from the skin fibroblasts of a patient with SQTS type 1 carrying a mutation (N588K) in KCNH2.

functional_data.summary: The mutation increased the expression of HERG channels and altered calcium homeostasis in the human iPSC-CMs.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was associated with a significant phenotype in the patient.
key_quotes: The mutation increased the expression of HERG channels and altered calcium homeostasis in the human iPSC-CMs.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Human iPSCs have been derived from a patient with LQTS and confirmed to carry a novel variant of uncertain significance (VUS) in KCNH2.

functional_data.summary: The electrophysiological abnormalities observed in the patient human iPSC-CMs were corrected upon correcting the VUS.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was classified as a VUS due to lack of clear pathogenicity evidence.
key_quotes: Human iPSCs have been derived from a patient with LQTS and confirmed to carry a novel variant of uncertain significance (VUS) in KCNH2.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
